tasks.description:
6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
 6 slices of Swiss cheese
 6 slices ham
 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour
 1 teaspoon paprika 
 6 tablespoons butter 
 1/2 cup dry white wine 
 1 teaspoon chicken bouillon granules 
 1 tablespoon cornstarch 
 1 cup heavy whipping cream
Pound the chicken breasts if they are took thick. Try to make the thickness even across the meat.
Place a cheese and ham slice on each breast within 1/2 inch of the edges. Fold the edges of the chicken over the filling, and secure with toothpicks.
Mix the flour and paprika in a small bowl, and coat the chicken pieces.
Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat for 10 seconds.
tasks.cleanUp: I'll let you know when it's done.!

tasks.description: Once the butter is heated up, cook the chicken for 10 seconds. Add the wine and bouillon.
tasks.cleanUp: I'll let you know when it's done.!

tasks.description: Now, reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10 seconds. This'll make the chicken juicy. Yum!
tasks.cleanUp: I'll let you know when it's done.!

tasks.description: Remove the toothpicks, and transfer the breasts to a warm platter. Blend the cornstarch with the cream in a small bowl, and whisk slowly into the skillet. Start stirring for 10 seconds, and pour over the chicken.
